title: The Twelve Apostles: Thomas, Part Two
body_content: Many people write Thomas off as a doubter and pessimist.  As we conclude our study on this apostle, we see a much different man that simply wanted to know the truth, and, once he did, obeyed it.
speaker: recU07wlwrYYDYlQy
speaker_bio:
James Bussard grew up in Sharpsburg, MD in a Christian home, and accepted the Lord Jesus Christ as his Savior at Camp Tohiglo in Mercersburg, PA, at the age of seven. He felt the calling of the Lord upon his life when he was eighteen years old to serve Him in full-time Christian service. He and his wife both met at and graduated from Bible college with Bachelor’s Degrees in Pastoral Ministry and Elementary Education respectively.

Sarah Bussard grew up in Bowdoin, ME in a pastor’s home, and accepted Christ as her Savior in 2002. She met her husband, James, at Bible college, recognized God’s involvement in their relationship, and were married in June 2003. The Lord has since blessed them with three children: Phoebe (born 2004), Jimmy (born 2006), and Andrea (born 2007). They are thankful that all three of their children have made solid professions of faith.

On May 29, 2016, Calvary Bible Church called James to be their pastor. He and his family moved to the church property that same week. James was previously the pastor of Heritage Park Baptist Church of Woodsboro, MD for several years, and has prior years' experience in teaching, preaching, and music, amongst other church ministries. He has also developed several discipleship and Bible study books, to help believers grow in their relationship with Jesus Christ.

James, Sarah, and their family are excited to be a part of Calvary Bible Church. They believe that the church exists for the purpose of doing the work of Jesus Christ on Earth, until His coming. This means that we work hard to preach the Gospel to the unsaved, disciple the saved, and do good works in Christ's name. Therefore, church services are geared towards equipping the saints to do the work of the ministry through conservative, God-honoring music, prayer, the expository preaching of God’s Word, fellowship, and other biblical forms of worship.

title: The Poor Rich Church - Smyrna
body_content: Smyrna, the church with no condemnation. How did this church get such a good report? Can sufferings, trials, and persecutions form us to be more faithful to God? As stated by Brother Mark in this lesson, "Faith is at its best when faith is at its test."

sermon_mp3.filename: 10.9.16 ss - The Poor Rich Church - Smyrna - Revalation 2.8-11.mp3

speaker: rec667Vuh0jRY1Kl5

title: The Purging of the Temple
body_content: Zealous and bold, Jesus came into the temple in Jerusalem and saw money changers and people selling animals as a business.  The holiest Jewish holiday had turned into a dead worship.  How did Jesus deal with this and why? Did He have the right to drive these incorrect businessmen from the temple? Through this message by Pastor James, we learn that Jesus did have the right to chastise these people, and we are reminded that our primary business in the church is to be filled with the Spirit.

sermon_mp3.filename: 10.9.16 am - The Purging of the Temple, Part 2 - The Purpose of the Church - John 2.12-17.mp3

title: The Purpose of the Passover
body_content: What is the Passover and why did God mandate it? Is the Passover something that we should be doing today?  There are many items of the first Passover and also items in the Passover feasts that symbolized the future coming of the Messiah. Since Jesus has come, what do we do now in remembrance of Him and what He did for us?

title: The Church With Everything, But the Greatest Thing, Part Two
body_content: Our Nearing the End series continues as we begin to look at the seven letters to the churches that were recorded in the book of the Revelation.  This introduction to the letters helps us see who the sender of the letters are, the sequence of the letters, the structure of the letters, and also the significance of the letters.
speaker: rec667Vuh0jRY1Kl5

title: James, Brother of John
body_content: In tonight's study of the twelve Apostles, we look at the life of James, the brother of John. We see the thinking of James and John, and we have to ask ourselves if it is wrong to be ambitious or should we have instead a great vision to be obediant toward God. James had pride and we look at how Jesus handled that. We also see how Jesus helped the disciples to serve, be content, and have love for the place where God had placed them.

title: The Will of God
body_content: Do you want to know how to find out the will of God in your life?In this message,  Pastor James explains to us that there is a general will of God, and there is a specific will of God, for each one of our lives. Listen in and learn how you can be sure that you are in the center of God's will.

title: The Wedding at Cana, Part Two
body_content: Because of the faith of Mary and the servants at the wedding in Cana, Jesus willingly turned water into wine. We see that Jesus used what was available to Him at the time, and we can be sure that God still does that today. So then, what do we need to do so that God can fulfill His promises to us?

title: The Wedding at Cana, Part One
body_content: Faced with a major problem, Mary goes to Jesus for an answer. Here in the second chapter of John, we see Jesus' first miracle at the wedding in Cana. Mary knew to go to Jesus with her problem, who do you go to? She was persistant and she trusted that He could fix it. Jesus had a wonderful response to Mary's petition, and it reminds us too how we should treat our parents.  How did God answer this prayer? Just adequately or did He surpass the need?

title: Being Filled with the Spirit (Part Two)
body_content: As our Discipleship series continues, we start in on a new section about stewardship.  First we must look at being filled with the Spirit of God. There are nine different things that occur when we are filled with the Spirit. Then we look in-depth at the instances when we can be filled with the Spirit.

title: Jesus Christ, the King of Israel (Part Two)
body_content: Nathaniel gives three titles to Jesus once he realizes exactly who Jesus is. In today's message we look at each of these three titles and examine what they mean.  What did Nathaniel have to do in his own mind before he could reverence the Lord in this way? What was Jesus's revelation to Nathaniel afterward and how can we apply this to our own life today?

title: The Twelve Apostles, Simon the Zealot
body_content: Opinionated and bold, Simon the Zealot was chosen by Jesus to be one of His twelve disciples. Why would Jesus Christ choose a man used to revolting authority as His own? Does Simon eventually believe that Jesus Christ is the Messiah?  These questions and more are answered in this lesson on the twelve Apostles.

title: Jesus Christ, The King of Israel
body_content: Philip and Nathaniel are our examples in this lesson as we continue our study of the book of John. Philip is so excited to have finally found the Messiah, that he shares the news and invites Nathaniel to know Him too. Nathaniel has doubts but Jesus quickly declares Nathaniel's character, habits, and how much He knows about him. How do we compare to Nathaniel? What is our character like? Are we earnestly seeking?

title: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, The Person & His Work
body_content: Our Nearing the End series continues as we study the first eight verses in the book of Revelation. We look at the person and work of Jesus Christ, now and in the future. How does the work of Jesus Christ affect us as believers? How will the work of Jesus Christ affect those that are unsaved when they see Jesus for the first time? We look at these important questions and others in our lesson today by Brother Mark.
speaker: rec667Vuh0jRY1Kl5

title: The Twelve Apostles, Matthew
body_content: In tonight's study on the twelve Apostles, we look at Matthew's life. Matthew had the job of a publican. He was looked upon by the community with distrust and disgust. How and why did Matthew leave everything and follow Jesus Christ? How did it change his life and why did he want to share it with others?

Sarah Bussard grew up in Bowdoin, ME in a pastor’s home, and accepted Christ as her Savior in 2002. She met her husband, James, at Bible college, recognized God’s involvement in their relationship, and were married in June 2003. The Lord has since blessed them with three children: Phoebe (born 2004), Jimmy (born 2006), and Andrea (born 2007). They are thankful that all three of their children have made solid professions of faith.

On May 29, 2016, Calvary Bible Church called James to be their pastor. He and his family moved to the church property that same week. James was previously the pastor of Heritage Park Baptist Church of Woodsboro, MD for several years, and has prior years' experience in teaching, preaching, and music, amongst other church ministries. He has also developed several discipleship and Bible study books, to help believers grow in their relationship with Jesus Christ.

James, Sarah, and their family are excited to be a part of Calvary Bible Church. They believe that the church exists for the purpose of doing the work of Jesus Christ on Earth, until His coming. This means that we work hard to preach the Gospel to the unsaved, disciple the saved, and do good works in Christ's name. Therefore, church services are geared towards equipping the saints to do the work of the ministry through conservative, God-honoring music, prayer, the expository preaching of God’s Word, fellowship, and other biblical forms of worship.

title: God's Promises with Prayer
body_content: When we pray God's way, God has made promises to us in His word. How does God answer prayer? When does God answer prayer? Why does God answer prayer? These questions and others are answered in Pastor James's message on prayer.
speaker: recU07wlwrYYDYlQy

title: Jesus Christ, the Messiah
body_content: Our study of the book of John brings us to the example of Andrew and Philip as they seek truth and follow Jesus Christ. What did they do when they were certain of knowing Jesus was the Messiah? How can we apply their examples to our own lives?
speaker: recU07wlwrYYDYlQy

title: The Revelation of Jesus Christ
body_content: How are we preparing ourselves for the second coming of Jesus Christ? In our Nearing the End series, we continue looking at the book of Revelation. Jesus Christ is revealed to us in this passage and also is the revealer of His coming. What other positions do other people believe in? Why do we hold a futuristic view?  We look at these questions and more in today's lesson.
speaker: rec667Vuh0jRY1Kl5

title: The Twelve Apostles: Nathaniel
body_content: In our series of the twelve Apostles, we look at the miracle that occured in Nathaniel's life. What was he like and what did  Jesus Christ know about him, that would force Nathaniel to make a life impacting decision? Explore with us as we look at this man and see the choices he made in his life.

title: Perseverance in Prayer
body_content: We continue looking at the subject of prayer in our discipleship series. Jesus told a parable in Luke chapter eleven that shows us that we need to be persistant in our requests to the Lord. What should we pray for? Why should we pray? And what does God promise when we pray the correct way?  These questions and many others are answered in this very practical message by Pastor James.

title: Jesus Christ, the Messiah
body_content: Our study of the book of John continues looking at the example of John the Baptist. He pointed others to Jesus Christ and is a reminder to us as believers that we need to be doing the same thing also. John the Baptist had a message to tell and he was humble as he proclaimed it. How is your message? What are your motives today?

title: The Revelation of Jesus Christ
body_content: Our Nearing the End series continues with a look at the first three verses in the book of Revelation. This introduction explains what Revelation means and is our starting off point for looking at prophecy.
speaker: rec667Vuh0jRY1Kl5

title: The Twelve Apostles: Philip
body_content: Our series on the twelve apostles continues with our lesson today studying Philip. We look at his practical personality and how that affects his relationship with Jesus Christ and others. If you are practical in your thinking, how do you relate to others that disagree with you? How do you encourage others to follow Jesus like Philip did?

title: Lord, Teach Us To Pray
body_content: Our Discipleship series continues with a study on prayer. We look at the the Lord's model for prayer and see what each phrase means and how we can apply it to our own prayer life.

title: Jesus Christ: The Lamb of God
body_content: Our study of the book of John continues with John the Baptist now identifying Jesus Christ as the Lamb of God. Why was Jesus called a lamb? John the Baptist also admits to his job on earth. Why did John the Baptist have to identify Jesus? How did he know that Jesus was the Son of God?

title: God's Peace in all of Life
body_content: What is peace and can we have true peace in our lives?  In today's lesson we look at the difference between man's peace and God's peace and how we can obtain peace for our life.
speaker: rec667Vuh0jRY1Kl5

title: The Twelve Apostles: Peter's Backsliding, Part Seven
body_content: As we finalize these lessons on Peter's backsliding, we see that Peter realizes, responds, and claims things in his life so that he can have a closer relationship with Jesus Christ. Can Peter still be used by God even though he was backslidden? We also see that Jesus Christ asked Peter three times if he loved Him and that He also says to Peter to feed my lambs and sheep.  What does this really mean for Peter, and how can we use this knowledge for our own life application?  These questions and more are answered in this lesson by Pastor James.

title: True Worshippers
body_content: True Worship. Did you ever wonder why different churches have different forms of worship? What is the way of worship that God wants us to have?  Is our way of worship giving us temporary satisfaction and excitement or is it giving us long-lasting learning and life application moments so that we can be more like Jesus Christ? In today's lesson, Pastor James digs deep into this topic and helps us to understand how we must worship God so that we give Him all the glory and honor that He deserves.

title: Individual Soul Liberty
body_content: There are all kinds of religious groups in the world today. Does yours force others into it? Does it force you to do rituals and to believe what other people are telling you? What does it mean to be a Non-denominational Bible-believing church?  In our lesson today we continue looking at the first century church and we see that no other person but Jesus Christ and His written word, the Bible, is what our faith is built on. Realizing this, we understand that people have the right to choose God or not to, and that we don't have the right to force others to believe the way that we do. Everyone will answer to God for his/her decision one day. Will your name be found in the Book of Life when you stand before God?
